  • Method Details

    • deserializeRequestValid

      public void deserializeRequestValid()
      Tests if string is correctly deserialized to JsonObject. Should create a JsonObject of type {string: string} when given a serialized object.

    • deserializeRequestInvalid

      public void deserializeRequestInvalid()
      Tests if invalid json throws JsonSyntaxException Should throw, since no value is given to the key 'param'.

    • requestBodyAsStringValidTest

      public void requestBodyAsStringValidTest() throws IOException
      Creates a mock request with a bytestream body, which is handled by the getRequestBodyAsString method used in the CI server.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the BufferedReader in getRequestBodyAsString fails to read. Is passed a serialized json object, should return the same object.

    • requestBodyAsStringInvalidTest

      public void requestBodyAsStringInvalidTest() throws IOException
      Asserts that when something goes wrong, such as there being no content in the request, the returned value is simply nothing.
      Throws:
      IOException - if BufferedReader in getRequestBodyAsString fails to read.

    • getRefSuffixValidTest

      public void getRefSuffixValidTest()

    • getRefSuffixInvalidTest

      public void getRefSuffixInvalidTest()
